subject: Climate & Environment
title: Biodiversity Hotspots
description: Learn Biodiversity Hotspots in one minute.

hook.text: 36 regions hold over half of all plant species on Earth â€” on just 2.5% of the land.

buildup.text: These hotspots include Madagascar, the Andes, and the Philippines â€” all species-rich.

discovery.text: To qualify as a hotspot, a region must have at least 1,500 unique plant species and have lost 70% of habitat.

twist.text: Protecting just these 36 areas would safeguard a disproportionate share of global life.

climax.text: Most hotspots are in developing nations that lack funds for conservation.

punchline.text: Life concentrates in a few places. Losing them means losing everything.

quiz.question: How much of Earth's land do biodiversity hotspots cover?
